question: Runway burning fast. First hire as founder? (Hormozi-style first hire polls)
options: A) Part-time expert freelancer (+15 - efficient, low commitment)
B) Full-time junior dev (+10 - quick internal build)
C) Outsource MVP to agency (+7 - fast launch, hands-off)
D) Build it yourself first (+4 - zero burn, learn fast)

question: 3 startup ideas. Which to pick? (Hormozi 'choose the one' framework)
options: A) Solve known hard problem (+15 - defensible moat)
B) Solve unknown problem (+10 - high PMF upside)
C) Execute better than others (+7 - speed advantage)
D) Copy proven model (+4 - lower risk validation)

question: Boom or gloom market to launch? (Andrew Chen market timing threads)
options: A) Gloom: Less competition (+15 - easier to stand out)
B) Boom: Easy funding & talent (+10 - momentum)
C) Gloom: Build strong fundamentals (+7 - antifragile)
D) Boom: Fast user validation (+4 - quick feedback)

question: $1000 MRR. How to report ARR? (Eric Bahn dodgy ARR tweets)
options: A) Conservative: $120k ARR (+15 - credibility)
B) Realistic projection: $300k ARR (+10 - optimistic but defensible)
C) Aggressive: $1M ARR (+7 - investor excitement)
D) Hype viral: $9M ARR runway story (+4 - buzz, high risk)

question: AI cofounder skill mix? (Kyle's X poll on AI cofounder)
options: A) Product + Tech: Ship MVP fast (+15 - execution)
B) Marketing + Sales: Monetize quickly (+10 - revenue)
C) Product + Marketing: Acquire users (+7 - growth)
D) All three spread thin (+4 - balanced but slow)

question: Decision paralysis killing momentum? (Jynro founder pain #1)
options: A) Kill 90% of ideas, focus on 3 (+15 - ruthless focus)
B) Prioritize by highest ROI (+10 - data-driven)
C) Team vote + gut check (+7 - alignment)
D) Test all small-scale (+4 - learn by doing)

question: Observe a local business. Best way to 10x it? (Nick Huber style)
options: A) Cut costs 20-30% (+15 - instant margin)
B) Add one high-margin revenue stream (+10 - growth)
C) Optimize staff & ops (+7 - efficiency)
D) Renegotiate rent/suppliers (+4 - quick wins)

question: Big hairy vision or small knowable idea? (Jon Lai / Paul Graham debate)
options: A) Ambitious long-term vision (+15 - attracts talent/VC)
B) Small wedge into big market (+10 - PMF first)
C) Knowable small problem (+7 - fast validation)
D) Scale small idea later (+4 - low risk)

question: Elon-level productivity secret? (pmarca X threads)
options: A) Long hours + ruthless focus (+15 - output max)
B) Delegate everything non-core (+10 - leverage)
C) Hire only A-players (+7 - team strength)
D) Work-life balance & recharge (+4 - sustainability)

question: VC meeting: Best way to avoid monologue? (Eric Bahn advice)
options: A) Ask questions first, listen 80% (+15 - build rapport)
B) Pitch tight 5-min version (+10 - respect time)
C) Lead with metrics & traction (+7 - proof)
D) Share story & vision (+4 - emotional hook)

question: SaaS pricing strategy? (Jason Lemkin benchmarks)
options: A) Value-based (tied to ROI) (+15 - highest growth)
B) Hybrid sub + usage (+10 - flexible)
C) Tiered with clear upgrades (+7 - predictable)
D) Freemium + progressive paid (+4 - PLG growth)

question: Churn spiking. Best first fix? (SaaS metrics threads)
options: A) Improve onboarding + first value (+15 - retention)
B) Add success manager touchpoints (+10 - high-touch)
C) Price increase on renewals (+7 - revenue)
D) Feature requests backlog (+4 - long-term)

question: Raising pre-seed. Best deck slide? (Eric Bahn deck rants)
options: A) TAM + problem size first (+15 - big vision)
B) Traction / early metrics (+10 - proof)
C) Team & why you (+7 - founder-market fit)
D) Product demo + screenshots (+4 - show don't tell)

question: Product stuck. Best next step? (Paul Graham essays)
options: A) Talk to users daily (+15 - real feedback)
B) Ship small features fast (+10 - momentum)
C) Rewrite tech debt (+7 - future speed)
D) Pivot slightly (+4 - new direction)

question: Sales cycle too long? (Jason Lemkin advice)
options: A) Target smaller companies first (+15 - faster closes)
B) Build self-serve onboarding (+10 - PLG layer)
C) Add case studies & proof (+7 - trust)
D) Discounts for annual (+4 - cash upfront)
